class_notes:
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)
Title: Sounds of Protest & Change: Lit, Sound, & Civil Rights
Course Description:
This course explores music, recorded sound, and literature produced in the context of or in response to US Civil Rights and Black Power political movements. We will read and listen to key voices, honing our critical listening skills to understand the dynamic sociopolitical milieu from which these movements emerged, extending our listening to the broader diaspora to hear resonances of multiple Black freedom movements in the tumult of the 1960's and 1970's.
course_description: Variable topics in African American Studies.
